Setting up Jekyll with Bootstrap, Github pages and a custom domain

After heading down a few different paths, cloning a working site worked best. Now I'm ready to customize a good-looking, working setup.

All thanks are due to Garry Welding who has an amazing blog post about setting up Jekyll on GitHub Pages with Bootstrap

Prior to finding Gary's solution I went down a number of promising paths. All of which probably would be great, except that it was much faster to copy someone who had recently done the setup.

First attempts

  • Jekyll Bootstrap
  • Yes We Jekyll
  • I liked their suggestion to use Foundation instead of Bootstrap

Next steps

  • get some sleep
  • See if I should be using Octopress
  • Customize the CSS
  • Learn more about RDiscount and Markdown
  • Add Instagram photos and more social elements

July 26, 2013 |
